news.title: Gold is on a record run — here's how to invest, according to experts
news.summary: Interest in physical gold and gold-related financial investments has soared amid the precious metal's recent rally. Here’s what to know before diving in.

news.title: Japan Prime Minister Ishiba Shigeru says he will step down after election setback
news.summary: Ishiba had faced calls for his resignation after the ruling Liberal Democratic Party failed to secure a majority in the lower house election on Oct. 27.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts prefer these 3 dividend-paying stocks for consistent income
news.summary: TipRanks' ranking service highlights three dividend-paying stocks. Archrock and Permian Resources are two of them.

news.title: Roblox announces short-video, AI features amid child safety concerns
news.summary: Roblox announced new short-video and AI features on Friday. Comes amid increasing lawmaker scrutiny into how the company protects children on its platform.

news.title: Behind the AI talent war: Why tech giants are paying millions to top hires
news.summary: Tech companies are battling for talent to get ahead in the AI arms race. It costs billions of dollars to build artificial intelligence models, and tech companies are competing for talent.

news.title: ‘I am my mother’s caregiver’: My mom, 93, added my name to her bank and retirement accounts. Will she qualify for Medicaid?
news.summary: “Will Medicaid be able to take the money from her bank account?” she asks. “ will Medicaid be can’t take theMoney from herbank account?" “What’s going to happen to the money in her account?"

news.title: ‘Fun came before paying bills’: My brother-in-law is in his 70s and homeless. Are we responsible for him?
news.summary: “At one point, he was even taking items from friend’s homes when they let him stay with them,” she says.

news.title: My mother, 81, discovered her ‘millions’ in investments are gone. What can I do?
news.summary: “She’s a very proud woman,” her daughter says of her mother. “I’m very proud of her,’ she adds.

news.title: I’m about to inherit a lot of money. How do I make sure my husband doesn’t get any of it?
news.summary: “We want to invest the money and play catch up with our retirement savings/funding,” he says. “We’re trying to get ahead of the game,’ he adds.

news.title: My friend married for a second time. Will the kids from her first marriage lose their inheritance?
news.summary: “Her husband wants to be the administrator of their trust,” says a friend of the couple. “She’s very, very proud of her family,’ the friend adds.
